instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing P3V3S3_EN
threads.message: 820-2838 not turning on, has green light on charger (just noticed stays green ??) no fan spin missing P3V3S3_EN (no short to ground) at q7903 which if im right comes from PM_SLP_S4_L , i dont seam to have any of the power rails from PM_SLP_S4_L (S3 rails) , mmm now im confused or am i just going to lose with this one as that seams to come from the cpu , board had minor liquid spill but does have signs of being worked on before

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing P3V3S3_EN
threads.message: Green light staying green is normal on these antiques. Also you need to manually power them on by shorting the power pads on SMC_ONOFF. If there is still no power check voltage on both pins of Y2810.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing P3V3S3_EN
threads.message: Hi Duke on pin 1 (RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN) i get 1.6v and on pin 2 (RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT) i get  1.75v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2838 not turning on green light on charger no fan spin missing P3V3S3_EN
threads.message: now i feel stupid -:) shorting the pads turns it on , thanks duke i will be sure to remember that one
